caption: Received service within seconds after walking in. We were seated at the bar, service was amazing as well as the food. We discovered this place by accident, however, I'm certain we will plan to come again soon!!
This place is a treat every time! Excellent food and service. Their outdoor backyard is so cute. Can’t wait to be back!

BURRITOS WILL ROCK YOUR WORLD. Homemade wrap is almost like a roti. Hot sauce is spicy. Avocado is ripe. Not too much eggs. Beans are tasty. They will put extra hot sauce inside for you. Staff is always charming.

Incredible seasonal menu. Natural wines, informative staff who is clearly passionate and informed about menu, ingredients and process. Large & helpful, genuinely friendly, super knowledgeable staff. Feels like coming home in a weird way! Huge, space heated outdoor area too (and spacious indoor). Just had the monkfish menu item which was a change up and it was FANTASTIC. I also loved the salt turnip and potato based dish. Honestly it was all really really good.

Oxalis is a diamond in the rough. Just went there last night and had some of the best food and service in NYC. Food was special without trying too hard and beverage pairing was unique but at the same time still complemented our meal really well. All around good vibes and definitely a must try. Can't wait to go back!
Great food

We went to celebrate a birthday and everyone there made it a special meal. The service was impeccable and the food was delicious. There were some dishes we weren't in love with, but it wasn't to the extent that I'm not eager to return to see what the chef offers throughout the year. I also tried the beverage pairing and felt it was one of the more thoughtful and unique ones I've had in some time. They offered wine, sparkling wine, cider, and a cocktail!
Delicious and unexpected blend of flavors
Absolutely worth every penny. Delicious cuisine and amazing friendly staff
One of the most memorable meals I’ve had in Brooklyn. They made my birthday very special!

The best dining experience I’ve had in the COVID era.  Food was superb, service was excellent (in both menu knowledge and safety protocols). Atmosphere is minimalist but charming. I went solo But could be a great date spot. Highly recommend.

Having a reservation works amazing, we had a reservation last Friday at 7:00pm and got  seated right away. The staff and the restaurant policies on covid times are excellent, the space between tables is great as well! Food is always great, the staff is always attentive and kind. On the other hand, the menu is always changing which can be exhausting . The best thing here is a la carte instead of the tasting menu! Keep it up!!
Perfect summer menu with great staff even during this pandemic

Underwhelming small plates of fussiness. The menu has completely changed from what's online, instead of duck, for example, the menu now consists mostly of little dishes that don't really satisfy. The red berry dish sounded amazing, but ended up being a group of arranged small pitted berries. The cheddar cheese was just that with bread. The ham was just thinly sliced ham. The waiter suggested getting 4-5 dishes, but it really felt like a money grab of protein- free choices.

“It’s summer in your mouth” - really fresh food, great staff, and fun experience in a COVID world. I would recommend having a fancy-or not so fancy-date night here. Oxalis was really creative in their outdoor space sourcing umbrellas from Campari and making use of a previously abandoned(?) driveway. They hung up string lights, custom built a drink station/check out counter and are really good at keeping everything socially distanced. The overall effect is fancy grunge, which creates a cool juxtaposition against the dressed up diners.

First time dining out in NY since the pandemic. Loved the courtyard that provided social distance, contactless service, and amazing food with a lovely breeze and ambiance. Everything was delicious, and it meant so much to be able to be out in a safe environment. The stone fruit with shio koji and fresh coriander seeds was my favorite.

The menu is pre-set. All courses are determined by the kitchen. There is seating in the back with no reservation requirements; where you can order a la carte but not all plates in the main dining room are available & vice versa. Also detailed descriptions (they are exhaustive) offered almost no insight to the flavors of the dish. I've eaten in both places I had things in the Main dinning room that I just would not have thought to order but turned out to be wonderful. I was also practically bursting in the Main by the end. (Full disclosure; 2 helpings of bread the first to eat: 2nd to throughly clean my plate. Less work for the dishwasher! Your welcome.) So you decide.  Short Review: You ever watch Top Chef & think "Who do I have to sleep with to be in that dinninroom?" ME! You have to sleep with me! Or I suppose you could just go here. Gourmand,  epicurean,  if this is you, Eat here NOW! otherwise "this is not the restaurant your looking for." You like big hearty portions, there are many OTHER fine restaurants in the neighborhood. You think food has gotten too pretentious then Nooo! Please keep it moving folks. There is nothing to see here!  Long version: Critiquing dishes is not helpful here because of the constantly changing menu. Everything was Very Good & @ least 3 things were Absolutely Amazing! Even the things I did not particularly care for,  like the asparagus were Very Good. At first a little sour but as you got into: just the changes in texture & nuance of flavors were so very interesting. I found a smear of deliciousness hidden under a piece of asparagus that made the last 3 bites the best of the whole plate. These dishes present as a beautiful mosaic but meant to be thoughtfully explored. Every bite is different. Each dish was a work of art; beautiful, delicious & so flipping interesting! For what it is worth: Friday the 13th my favorites were the; octopus, spring stew, lamb, & the dessert

Servers were professional and welcoming, but course timing was sometimes off. Drinks sometimes came long before the course they were to be paired with, and once they came before one of us was done with the previous drink. We'd dropped some bread crumbs on the table from the delicious but very crumbly bread early on, and it wasn't cleaned up until 1+ hours later before the final course, which isn't a big issue but not exceptional attention to detail. The $70 food was quite delicious and worth the price, but the $50 beverage pairing was not. The first and last drinks were fairly good, but the rest were overwhelmingly dank ciders and wines. They had only that one note, and it was not only odd tasting but didn't pair well with food. The music was a little too overwhelming and too loud; at times it drifted to calmer music better suited to a nice dinner but invariably drifter back.

Found this hidden gem, 1 Michelin star restaurant in Brooklyn.  Very reasonable price for tasting menu, well presented favorable dishes, relaxed ambience with friendly staffs.  I came here for our anniversary. Unfortunately, I accidentally booked Barroom table which is the back area called A La Carte, garden room. My bad not reading the confirmation for A la carte while I’ve made dining room notification. Cancellation FEE a $30 per person is ABSOLUTELY absurd for the garden room when they don’t serve course menu... plus the garden room was very empty.  Quite disappointed with obscure reservation system in RESY but the staff offered complimentary drinks and some dishes from Dining room to try for our anniversary. I assumed, the waitress/manager’ve handled this kind of situation a lot… very professional.  The fact that La Carte; the garden room has different menu from dining room, we tried 5 dishes. Overall, the food was appetizing. My favorites were fluke with radish and oxalis’ kebab. My least fav was tilefish which was very salty.  Portion is very small like tapas, almost bite-size. I would go back for dining room and also the garden room when it gets warm. (My feet were freezing....)
Great service and nice atmosphere!! The menu & wine pairing were a little too citrusy for me
Nothing was too exciting but everything was executed beautifully, also dining solo at the bar was a good time. Pretty space

The service was outstanding. Server was friendly.  But do they deserve a Michelin star? The barley was fantastic, the roti was meh, and everything else was bland. The flat bread had no taste. The mille feuille pastry was like a tasteless cracker with an overly icy, tasteless, scoop of coffee "gelato". Maybe an off night.
Incredible tasting menu! They also offer non-alcoholic beverage pairings; all were great!

Awesome gem in Brooklyn. The food and wine were amazing but service even better. Steve (one of the partners) was wonderful. The amount of attention to detail was superb. My girlfriend has food allergies and they accommodated to her every need. Will definitely be back!
Great neighborhood refinement.
Had dinner here for a birthday. Food was cute, some dishes tho were too salty. We got the extra duck rice and it was very salty. :(

Great, lively atmosphere. The staff were attentive, friendly, and very knowledgeable. Food was exceptional and creative. In the dining room you already have a pre-set course so the only thing you order is either a drink pairing or any extras on a few dishes. Fun experience for those wanting to try some gastronomy-style dining on an easier budget.

Beautiful latrine room that smelled like lilacs and orange wine. Soft and spry towels that seemed to float through the air as I let them drop into the waste basket. The water was warming, and perfectly washed away the buttered ricotta on my hands. Enjoyed this experience. Will 100% go back.
Love the drink selection.

Enjoyed a fantastic dinner at Oxalis recently. The $70 tasting menu (w/beverage pairing +40) is a great value for the quality & inventiveness of this menu.  Thoroughly enjoyed the pacing of each course, which always seemed to arrive right on time, along with the wine. (Great touch as well, since we ordered cocktails to start, they changed our first pairing to an amaro at the end, a wonderful substitute that always adds a layer of satisfaction to the end of a meal) I genuinely look forward to returning and seeing what the chef has prepared next season.

Everything we ordered from the a la carte menu was fantastic. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly. One of the owners took our cocktail order and since they didn’t have egg whites he recommended trying burrata water. It was one of the best whiskey sours I’ve ever had. We will be back to try the tasting menu.
Great food and very attentive waitstaff. Would definitely go back!

The seasonal set menu was perfect from beginning to end. Everything was masterfully prepared, plated, and combined. Details like apple juice in the salmon and roe kept it surprising and worked really well. The whole staff was very friendly and service was just great. I loved finding such a gem in South Brooklyn.  I can't wait to try the a la carte menu and other seasonal options.
Love the a la carte menu back in the bar, favorite small plates in the city! Always some new.
Not cheap but a very fun place with incredible food
Excellent and imaginative food with above average service.

What a great hidden gem with their Michelin star. Very easy to miss. The service was fantastic. It got very crowded by 7:30 on a Tuesday. And quite frankly it may be the best value in the city for a Michelin star. $70 for the tasting menu. The chefs are in the open kitchen and say Hi as you enter and exit. Very friendly. Definitely a do over especially since it is walkable.

Overall was good. Great service and warming environment for dining room provided a nice experience on Sunday. However, tasting menu was $70 and wine pairing was $40. Good portion for wine pairing, 5 kind of different wine which was about 2.5 glasses for total. For me, here provided trendy organic (natural) wine as wine pairing, but i can’t really enjoy new concept wine at all. So, I can’t say it was good at all, but one white burgundy pairing with sea bass was really good; typical burgundy wine smell with vanilla cake long listing. For food, tasted ok, but no impressive at all. As French cuisine, I thought it was too light taste at all, of course, portion was little for all dishes. Especially you should pay about $250 for two persons’ dinner, you might need to have sth after here. There are more great taste restaurants and not so pricey ones in Manhattan. Just wondering this one is a trendy hipster style Brooklyn restaurant.
Are there for brunch. Service was great and the food delicious. Staff described each item on the menu as it was served to you. Gentleman Jim cocktail was a pleasant surprise.

Service was friendly and attentive. Decor is clean and modern. The layout has the kitchen in front of the dining room. It's neat. Latte was on point. The brunch menu is fixed with a reasonable price. The food was delicious with plenty of depth in flavors. A nice variety of dishes that unravels towards a fine dessert. The galette had the perfect play in texture and sweetness. Pleasant start to a Sunday morning. Street parking was abundant. Would come again.
Amazing food! Delightful and surprising tasting experience.

There are two options of dinning. 1.dinning room set menu or chef's choice 2. Bar area a la carte. I went with the a la carte option. Drinks were perfect the gentleman jim made with rum, nutmeg, sake was perfect for the cold winter night. Then came the house made bread with a perfect butter and roasted vegetables reduction. The fluke was not the most flavorful dish but the porridge has this unique flavorful that burst in your mouth(this was my favorite dish). The kebab was a nice touch with mushrooms and the spicy sauce , the perfect end was with the pear sorbet.

Inventive (if sometimes precious) food, funny attentive and knowledgeable staff. The format takes out the guesswork and frees the kitchen up to do their best work and frees you up to enjoy your dinner company.
Creative dishes. Outstanding dining experience
Inventive creative menu with lots of different to share amongst friends. Excellent cocktails and good selection of wines.
Such a fun and delicious experience! Thank you , can't wait to come back
Reasonable prie fixe menu of six courses for $70. There was a $30 supplement for white truffles. Good service and nicely executed dishes.

Thanks for having us! Second time here and we chose to do a la carte bar menu this time. In general I would say the a la carte food here are better than at least half of the NYC’s Michelin one-star restaurants. 🌟What we ordered: 1. Rum/grapefruit cocktail with Long Island rum and grand fir soda 2. Shacksbury farmhouse cider 3. House-made brioche, roasted root vegetable mage and butter 👍 4. Broadbent country ham 5. Lightly smoked trout, apple, horseradish 👍 6. Chicories, caramelized sake 7. Burrata, celtuce, dried scallop, nasturtium👍 8. Le kebab d’oxalis 👍 9. Pork and carrot👍 10. Duck, quince, perpetual spinach, wild juniper 11. Dark Chocolate, Jerusalem artichoke, toasted oats💯 12. Pear and sorrel The brioche is hot and buttery and the butter is perfect as well. The trout is super fresh, fatty and tender! I am not a burrata person but I really enjoy the burrata here with pepper oil. The bread looks like a sourdough but actually is much more oily than sourdough and thus matches the burrata quite well. The kebab is definitely a highlight of tonight. The mushroom tastes so good with the pitas! I never thought a mushroom wrap could be so delicious! The pork is also excellent, fatty meat with crispy skin. My favorite tonight would be the DARK CHOCOLATE CAKE! I would say you would regret for the rest of your life if you missed the chocolate cake. It’s hard to imagine that how they could make a simple chocolate mousse so delicious without any other ingredients. I never say that I could have something every day. But I would say I could have this dark chocolate cake every day! Oxalis really should include this dessert into the tasting menu to give it a strong end!

Has the tasting menu here. My partner enjoyed the wine pairing (not all wine - there was a cocktail, a sake and a cider) and I had a glass is wine. Service was very good. The main server was friendly and informative and answered all our questions. The food was all delicious! The oyster dish! The beef shoulder! I look forward to going back. The low point was dessert, but I was happily full by that point anyway.
The food, the service, the atmosphere... all done really well. This place is a great spot to have a meal in Brooklyn. You won’t be disappointed.

Great to have a reasonable priced (relatively) set menu joint in Brooklyn. One highlight was definitely the beverage pairing which was about the cost of a bottle of wine between two. The wine list in general is a lot of fun.  Some well done and innovative dishes. Believe it or not, the snack course and dessert were the biggest surprises.  The space itself is understated and a bit bizarre with the bar closed off in back.
A real find in Brooklyn. For NYC a fabulous and reasonably priced tasting menu.

Fabulous, interesting food, great value, nice service, and pretty garden in back – perfect neighborhood gem, and worth a trip if you’re further away. Also a nice Sunday brunch now, and interesting wine choices. Food is rather pretty New French/American, changing seasonally. The short prix fixe format means it’s fast, polished, and good value for such a small place. A great concept, perfectly executed!
Cute place, creative and delicious food.
Creative, exquisitely prepared tasting menu and warm, knowledgeable staff. Highly recommend.l

The food is AMAZING. Reading the descriptions we had no idea what we were getting but the food was incredible and the wine pairing was so perfect. We had the best meal and everyone who worked there is so warm, friendly, and knowledgeable. We loved it!

Best brunch I have had in eons.  The staff is so warm and lovely.  2nd time here and really consistent so far.  Flat price for a unique array of really delicious stuff uniquely prepared.  You can add on other delights as well. A beautiful creamy polenta with a shisito paste, to die for house made duck sausage, ratatouille with eggs on top complete with a lemon tart.  I had previously  been so underwhelmed with brunch menus, the fact no bread was involved just seals it.  This is a neighborhood gem, so I probably should not write this review, but the universe pulls me to share when it's great!  I have yet to have the dinner tasting menu, but that's on the horizon.  Forget the pancakes and eggs your style and by all means go out on a limb.
Amazing brunch. Why doesn't this place have a Michelin star?

Fave restaurant in the neighborhood. The food and the cocktails are excellent! The staff are super friendly. The tasting menu in the dining room and the a la carte menu in the bar room are both great.  The bar room is great if you wanna pop in for a quick bite and cocktail. Also, recently added Sunday brunch also quite excellent and interesting.  It’s not just the standard brunch food. Really a fantastic addition to the neighborhood.
Best restaurant in the neighborhood.
Delicous!

Great atmosphere! Tried the tasting menu which was great. Consists of 6 dishes with first 4 being vegetarian (I preferred it to the meat dishes actually). Great place for a date night or if friends and family are visiting and looking for a nice dinner meal.
High end, creative, vaguely french cuisine. Tried the garden menu, looking forward to trying the prix fixe
Good value for excellent quality
A dream: an ambitious, beautiful, thoughtful restaurant that manages to be both world-class and a neighborhood hangout. Our every course was a jewel, and the beverage menu was smart and delicious.
Absolutely fantastic food, cocktails and service. You will need a reservation if you like to taste the set menu, which I didn't get to try,  but they do have a separate menu for walk-ins.

I ate in  the bar  at a private event  and in the dining room. Each experience was different but enjoyable. Bar menu pork neck was excellent and so many dishes with things I have not had. Enjoyed the fact each time I tried things that were largely new to me and enjoyed my bites. This joint is clean true farm to table with knowledgeable staff great drinks and wines even mocktails I enjoyed. Felt great after eating not that food coma feeling that can come from a great place. Learned some things challenged my tastes and senses and left happy ready for my next adventure
Great food, the parsley drink is really nice!

Very unsuspecting from the outside, this restaurant opens up into a beautiful open kitchen with a couple great seating areas in the back. The atmosphere and the food are inventive, and the servers are extremely knowledgeable. Can't wait to go back!

I’d give it 0 stars if I could. Most disgusting food ever. They had me eat flowers for a “snack!” I nearly threw up and will never recommend this place to anyone. If you’re a crunchy granola kind of person who likes to eat dirt then maybe you’ll like this. But anyone with real tastebuds will realize you’re eating grass. Also the price was outrageous and all I got was green froth with every course. Horrible! And the chocolate was inedible. How could you screw up chocolate!?
Creative tasting menu using unpretentious ingredients. Truly outstanding!

We just went to this place for a special anniversary, and we absolutely loved it. Upon making a reservation and noting my dietary restrictions, the manager wrote an email to confirm that they would be preparing a special menu. When we arrived, there was a beautiful table set with a personalized note wishing us a happy anniversary. They poured us delicious bubbles to celebrate (twice!), and the food was fabulous. It was an amazing meal and the warm and attentive service made us feel right at home. We're excited to go back with friends and family!

I want to start by saying I NEVER write reviews. But I feel obligated to because oxalis exceeded every expectation we had.  I took my (beautiful) girlfriend here for her birthday - and the owner and the staff were to friendly and made it such a special experince.  Will definitely be back, and highly recommend.
Wow wow wow. Home run

Other than a twenty minute wait to take our order( there is only a set menu ), the service was fantastic.  The food is perfectly prepared, however it feels like each dish is missing something.  Didn't seem like anything was connected.  Space is a little weird with the bar in the back too.

Oxalis The service staff were fantastic. Atmosphere was lively and fun. Music was quite and enjoyable. The food was different than what I would have ordered in another restaurant we did the wine pairings and it was the best decision   Every dish was scrumptious and the attention to detail while preparing was exceptional. One wine served was so spot on we Had to order a bottle to go which they made an exception and sold it to us. Every dish they served was explained The night was magical for us thanks to this team of wonderful people, thank you all
Fluke and creamy farro. Ingredients are very fresh and presentation is so delicate.
Excellent tasting menu
Eclectic craftsmanship
terrific!

The meal I had at Oxalis was truly unforgettable. The food was outrageously delicious and interesting, the presentation was beautiful, the waiters were lovely and helpful, the drinks were perfectly balanced, and the space is gorgeous. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough!
Excellent tasting menu. Great price great vibe.
A true 5* experience! The Carte Blanche menu was wonderful and such a great value!
I can only say, Try this place now before he gets more known and of course expensive.

Every dish exceeded the previous dish. The savory food was so good, I found myself asking for more flavors despite being satiated by what was served to me. Pete Wells gave it 1 star knowing he was under rating the restaurant; I give it 5, knowing it is a sleeper hit waiting for the public to catch up. In a year people will be saying Pete Wells was crazy for giving it only 1 star.

The trout was exceptional and the rest of the food was very good. Even dishes that used ingrediants I don't particularly like were done in such a way that I wanted to keep eating them. An unqualified recommendation.

Nice ambiance, modern, casual-chic decor. Not pretentious or snobby. Pleasantly sober yet not boring or plain. Knowledgeable, attentive and friendly staff. Excellent service.  Fixed six-course dining is an experience for the palate. Dishes are rich and savory, one of the reasons why portions are rather tiny.  Nothing inherently wrong with that although, while generally fine, the amount of food served would benefit from a small increase in quantity as it'd be better to err on the side of having patrons leave a spoonful on their plate than leave them unsatisfied or wanting for more. Here the old Italian saying that somewhat translates into: "the eye too, wants its share" applies.  Again, let me be perfectly clear... quantity is most certainly not tragically insufficient but can be very easily improved with a small increase in size.  The presentation of the dishes served was well balanced and not overdone. The simple elegance was very welcome as it makes patrons feel at ease without falling short of remaining pleasing to the eye.  I would definitely recommend dining at Oxalis and to do so for a unique tasting experience.  That said a cautionary warning is due because if hungry, I would then recommend dining elsewhere.  The meal won't be satisfying if visiting Oxalis when feeling famished. That would certainly not be a good time to experience the fine dishes served in this establishment. And it would truly be a shame because, in addition to not being able to appreciate the fine food, one would end up feeling disappointed for all the wrong reasons.  Although I pointed out that a small increase in the portions' size would be certainly beneficial and welcome, it does not mean that the full course of dishes served will not make for a sufficient meal, quite the opposite in fact. It only means that one should be aware this is a place which requires patrons to be in a specific mood when coming to dine here. And that specifically, it would be a mood where one isn't looking for quantity, or worse, is feeling starved. It should rather be a mood in which one is really looking forward to exploring dishes with unusual taste and textures, experiencing flavors that will surprise one's sight, palate, sense of smell and taste... If you are in that mood then you absolutely must really go and try Oxalis.  The reason why I pointed out the need to be in the right mood is that that it will be an integral part of what will make it possible for your dining experience at Oxalis to become something truly memorable because, without that, it will be something nearly impossible to achieve when, much like the carnivore plant in the comedy movie "the little shop of horrors", one's brain is screaming just one thing: "feed me!" 😉
Very intimate place.
(Translated by Google) Perfect. Hurry up ... the good Michelin man will arrive  (Original) Perfect. Hurry up... le bon homme Michelin va arriver
Fantastic. Go.
The experience was incredible. Toya and James helped make our time there amazing. The food was delicious with unexpected yet incredible flavor. Definitely going back many times.

What a wonderful meal and experience; a lovely modern dining room, attentive staff and meal. The tasting courses were perfect. They were sorting out their liquor license during our visit, but even if still the case, do not let that deter you. It almost did for me and I’m really happy that I didn’t change my plans. Will eagerly return!

A neighborhood restaurant that sets some pretty high goals, and pretty much achieves them. Excellent service - and a larger waitstaff than you'd expect for a restaurant this size, pleasant, uncluttered vibe and food to write home about. It will be interesting to see what their wine pairings are when they begin servicing alcohol

We have been for both the bar menu (a la carte) and the dining room menu with the set courses menu, and both were delicious. The flavor combinations were unique and very well done, and the white chocolate dessert was one of the best things I've ever eaten. We will definitely be back!

We had a delicious meal at Oxalis. The staff was warm, engaging and welcoming. The space is simple with clean lines and pale gray paneling. Mushroom pot-au-feu with addition of (optional, extra charge) shaved truffles was outstanding with the earthy, chewy presence of plenty of maitakes. Duck breast was perfectly cooked and the skin was crisp with a slight spicy kick to it.  The Meyer lemon dessert course was superb and a perfect ending to the meal. The dishes were well composed and beautiful to look at as well.  The non-drinker in our party enjoyed the non-alcoholic drink pairing menu with a series of interesting and carefully constructed beverages that complemented the courses. Oxalis's liquor license was apparently (finally!) approved the day we ate there (Feb 8) and their drinks program should be up and running by next week. We were invited to bring a bottle of wine as they DO actually have a license now. The $25 corkage fee was annoying however, as there was no wine actually available for purchase and I think it was an overstep to charge it. Nevertheless, the meal was very enjoyable and for the price, the succession of dishes can't be beat.
Excellent restaurant!! Service is on point and food is great.

The complexity of the ingredients in the food lent themself towards delicate flavors that in certain dishes were not bold or highlighted enough. The flow of the restaurant was busy, and service was fine, but wish they explained the nuances of each dish without having to first prompt them
Pretentious garbage. A complete waste of 60$
Wow, a refined restauarant that should make its way toward a michelin star sooner rather than later

Extremely welcoming and warm staff, who were knowledgeable and attentive throughout the service, although we felt a tiny bit rushed moving on between dishes. The set menu was full of interesting items and every ingredient tasted like they extracted the best flavors out. Highlights were the farro and dessert courses. Non-alcoholic matching drinks were a welcome change, but I’m sure the soon-to-come liquor license will enhance the experience. Get in before they start serving wine and tables book out.
Outstanding service. Creative and delicious six course set menu. The matching (non alcoholic) drinks were great and we almost didn't mind not having wine with dinner.
Food is inventive and delicious.  A la carte dishes are all small.
Really amazing. They don't yet have their lower license, but they have amazing pairings with soft drinks. It's hard to think if anything that wasn't perfect. Would recommend without reservations

Oxalis’ food, service, aesthetic, and playlist are incredible!!! I’ve been here several times and most recently tried the set menu. There was a mushroom dish that was absolutely divine- the broth was incredible I could’ve had ten bowls of that alone. As of the last time I visited they didn’t have s liquor license yet but their non-alcoholic drinks are all so amazing I didn’t even care. My favorite drink was the sparking jasmine tea.

Delicious dinner, all dishes of the tasting course were amazing, the best was probably the scallops dish. The non alcoholic beverage pairing was quite good, can’t wait until they finally get their liquor license!
Great new experience!!

We went for New Years and had an incredible experience. The food was amazing - especially the beef tartar and the poached oysters and the dessert - and the service was superb. The space was beautiful. A world class restaurant in Brooklyn!
Amazing! Great service delicious unique food! We did the tasting menu with the non-alcoholic beverage pairing it was awesome!  Will be going back!

Excellent restaurant! Very good value for money and delicious food. The dining room has a very reasonable prix fixe menu and the more casual bar room has a small a la carte menu.  Highly recommend! It used to be a pop up restaurant before opening this permanent Outpost, so definitely worth checking out. Enjoy!

Their fluke, pretzel brioche, egg, beef shoulder,  and desserts are delicious. Attentive service and they want to make sure you have a great dining experience. They went out of their way to build a strong menu and I know they had tested the dish popularity through pop ups so when you go to the restaurant, you’re gonna get to pick from their best dishes.
A phenomenal meal. Cant wait to come back and try the next version of the menu. Prospect Heights has an amazing new addition.

An awesome overall dining experience. These guys are just starting out in their first brick and mortar spot and are already killing it. Just a matter of time until this place becomes a hit spot on the NYC scene. A coursed tasting menu is only $60! And the quality is that of a much higher price. They want to making fine dining accessible and not intimidating.  All courses were creative, beautiful, delicious, and inspired. Textures, colors, and flavor explosions. Drink pairings are non alcoholic for now and I must say they were amazing and really showed their skill in that they couldn’t be alcoholic. $15 for n/a drink pairing and will be I think $35 when they get liquor license.  Physical space and service are top notch. Clean space, open kitchen, great bar room, hip hop on the stereo, and high end service all contributed to a memorable meal.
First class resto.  Better that Olmstead.  Run to Oxalis.  Then again don't, because then I won't be able to get a table for weeks.
Outstanding food and service.  Everything was well thought out and exquisitely prepared

This was one of the best dining experiences we have had in a long time!  From the service, to the setting, to the outstanding food- Oxalis was amazing!  And for only their second night too!  We cannot wait for our next visit... Congrats to Chef Nico and Steve for what will certainly be a huge success!
Excellent restaurant and service!  Creative and seasonal fine dining.  Elevated bar menu.
Great restaurant. Food was delicious and service was spectacular. Make sure to get both desserts in the bar area.
